sentences.english: There is an ancient saying in China, " civility costs nothing ".
sentences.chinese: 中國有一條古訓，“禮多人不怪”。

sentences.english: How to understand these old maxim ?
So, personally, I don’t like that old adage.
sentences.chinese: 所以說，我個人不同意這種古訓。

sentences.english: The wisdom of the ancients is precious for us.
sentences.chinese: 古訓對我們來說是寶貴的。

sentences.english: The ancient adage, a gentleman makes money through honourable means, still apply.
sentences.chinese: 君子愛財，取之有道，古訓也，現在仍適用。

sentences.english: Of that sublimest lore which man had dared unlearn?
sentences.chinese: 人們竟敢忘記古訓的崇高？

definition: Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
